Title: Insights Analyst III - Publishing
Description:
At Riot, we deliver unforgettable gaming, esports, and entertainment experiences to our fans around the world. Publishing is how we connect with those players, and Publishing teams focus on creating harmonized, holistic experiences around and across our entire product portfolio. Core capabilities include marketing, strategy, commercial partnerships, community management, player support, localization, and other experiences that span across products. Publishing Insights is a team of business strategists, researchers, and analysts that sits within Publishing Strategy & Operations, focused on deepening Riot’s understanding of how to engage with players and fans. Our work uncovers meaningful insights that help teams translate product strategy into Publishing actions, define our audience needs and motivations, and measure and test business performance.

As an Insights Analyst III with Publishing Insights, you will serve as a thought partner to business leaders making visible and meaningful investment and planning decisions. Your strong technical and analytical background will help ensure Riot’s Publishing priorities and investments deliver desired and data-backed outcomes. You will serve as a senior individual contributor to design and run experiments, educate stakeholders on experimentation best practices, and communicate findings utilizing a broad range of methodologies. You will report into the Publishing Insights Lead for VALORANT. This role is a hybrid work position, with some work onsite and some work from home. The onsite work location is at our global headquarters in Santa Monica, CA.

Responsibilities:

Experimentation Design and AnalysisPartner with other Insights, Publishing, and Product teams to scope, design, execute, measure, and improve the impact of our Publishing efforts for our fans and our businessAnalyze Publishing and player data to identify causal relationships between Publishing actions and player outcomes with a focus on all stages of the fan journey - including acquisition and retention, sentiment, lifetime value, messaging and promotions, engagement, and evangelism Develop and present slide decks with clear visualizations and narratives, effectively translating complex data into actionable insightsTake full ownership of projects from inception to completion, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality insights and recommendationsCapability DevelopmentDevelop Publishing’s R&D experimentation priorities, processes, and platforms, coordinating with partner teams to invest in necessary partnerships, tools, content, and dataServe as an informal mentor in the professional development of junior analysts and researchers


Required Qualifications:

6+ years experience in data analysis, data science, decision science, or similar quantitative fieldsDegree or meaningful work experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, or relevant technical fieldApplied experience delivering hypothesis-driven experiments including A/B testing, mix models, multi-touch attribution, and geo testing. Ability to leverage these methods for player segmentation, user sentiment analysis, and marketing campaign optimizationApplied experience in statistical modeling and analysis of large datasets, utilizing sampling theory, significance testing, and clustering analysis (e.g., k-means, latent class). Proficient in SQL and one or more statistical analysis platforms such as SPSS, R, Python, or similar scripting language for statistical modelingAbility to develop strong, open, and collaborative working relationships with peers and senior leaders 


Desired Qualifications:

Graduate degree in related quantitative fieldExperience working with common self-serve insights and data platforms, such as DataAI (formerly AppAnnie), GlobalWebIndex, NewZoo, NPD, or YouGovExperience working with global teams across diverse cultures


We think that the best candidates are those who are energized by figuring out what works and what doesn’t. This is a new focus area for many partner teams across Publishing, so proactivity, prioritization, patience, comfort with ambiguity, and a self-starter mindset are essential keys to success in this position.

For this role, you'll find success through craft expertise, a collaborative spirit, and decision-making that prioritizes the delight of players. We will be looking at your past studies, experience, and your personal relationship with games. If you embody player empathy and care about players' experiences, this could be your role!

Our Perks:

Riot has a focus on work/life balance, shown by our open paid time off policy, in addition to other perks such as flexible work schedules. We offer medical, dental, and life insurance, parental leave for you, your spouse/domestic partner and children, and a 401k with company match. Check out our benefits pages for more information.

Our platform delivers actionable insights for our customers to advance care and research, drive strategic growth, and achieve financial success. For more information, visit arcadia.io.

Why This Role Is Important To Arcadia

The Sr. Analyst will join the Analytics team of a high-growth Population Health and Analytics software company. This role reports to the Team Lead of VBC Contract Analytics and will involve creation of a set of contract analytics reports and insights.

The ideal candidate loves data and wants to make a difference. We are seeking individuals who rely on data analysis to make decisions and are passionate about improving the way healthcare is delivered to millions of patients across the country. You should be eager to share population health expertise to help Arcadia’s customers unlock more from their data.

Ideal candidate wants to innovate and is looking for the opportunity to bring their ideas around value-based contract analytics to life. This role has unlimited growth potential with the ability for an analyst to blaze their own path.

What Success Looks Like

In 3 months

- Gain familiarity with Arcadia’s data model and data ingestion process

- Learn analytics team’s reporting tools (Redshift SQL database, QuickSight BI product)

- Ideate with leadership and help shape new product design and delivery

In 6 months

- Have created a set of new insights for Arcadia customers into contract analytics

- Be able to manage customer meetings and have complex conversations about customer need

In 12 months

- Have a fully up and running contract analytics and modeling suite of tools

- Be regularly available to Sales and Marketing to help them describe and present your work to prospects

- Be Arcadia’s contract analytics subject matter expert

What You'll Be Doing

  • Ideating directly with third-party actuaries, Arcadia’s Chief Product and Technology Officer, and Chief Analytics Officer to build out a new contract analytics suite of reports and tools
  • Contribute your own thought leadership and IP to the Arcadia analytics products
  • Help Sales/Marketing by being the subject matter expert on contract analytics
  • Collaborating with talented colleagues – Product Managers, Analysts, and Data Scientists – across Arcadia’s Customer Insights, Data Science, and Product teams

What You'll Bring

  • 2+ Years of healthcare analytic experience
  • A deep understanding of value-based contracts and concepts such as capitation, MLR, Premium, and Risk share
  • Experience and familiarity with medical economics, risk algorithms, and quality
  • Comfortable speaking with clients about their value-based goals and objectives and translating those into concrete deliverables.
  • Experience analyzing claims data
  • Ability to query and manipulate relational databases with SQL
  • Eagerness to learn, a detail-oriented mindset, and a creative approach to problem solving

Would Love for You to Have

  • Experience working at a health tech data vendor, ACO/CIN Organization, or health insurance company
  • Experience in an actuarial department or with actuarial exams
  • A passion for communicating data through clear and compelling visual design
  • Experience with ETL
  • Experience with a business intelligence dashboarding tool such as QuickSight, Tableau, or Power BI
  • Experience with the AWS platform and writing Athena queries
  • Advanced SQL skills or familiarity with other languages such as Python or R
  • Experience using collaboration tools such as Jira and Confluence
  • Experience using statistical modelling and/or machine learning

What You'll Get

  • The opportunity to:
  • - Analyze large and diverse data sets on Arcadia’s custom data model built by analysts for analysts
  • - Create value add IP and quickly distribute it to wide array of Arcadia customers
  • - Ideate with the best minds in healthcare through our advisory network
  • - Support a wide variety of customers in the healthcare space – all focused on pulling healthcare tech into modernity
  • A collaborative team with decades of collective experience in population health, product development, and data science
  • A supportive and remote-work friendly company that provides frequent opportunities for fun and connection, as well as personal and professional development
  • Be a part of a mission driven company that is transforming the healthcare industry by changing the way patients receive care
  • A flexible, remote friendly company with personality and heart
  • Employee driven programs and initiatives for personal and professional development
  • Great benefits like flextime time off
  • Be a member of the Arcadian and Barkadian Community
  • Competitive compensation and amazing benefits, including flexible time off (~22 day company average)

The Central Mobile Analytics team is seeking a senior data analyst to bring their passion for mobile games and data driven cultures to life on new mobile initiatives!

Come work at a fast-paced and collaborative team where product management and mobile leadership will look to you for accurate information and insights on rapidly changing live game environments. Description

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insights that impact the daily business decisions of AWS? Do you want to have an impact on making strategic deals come to life? Are you excited to solve business challenges through data analytics and business intelligence (BI) solutions?

If so, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the Deal Tooling and Insights team to help solve business challenges through data analytics. Deal Tooling and Insights team provides tools, process monitoring, and bespoke analysis to our internal customers and help them meet their desired business outcomes while ensuring alignment with AWS business objectives.

In this role, you will harness your business and technical skills to understand business requirements, conduct data analysis and provide actionable insights to senior leadership. You will own suite of metrics for Weekly/Monthly business reporting, establish automated processes for large scale data analyses and create net new metrics to measure the health of the business. You will drive the development of new self-service reporting mechanisms to help scale and optimize the reporting processes across the organization. You will work with Data Engineers, Product Managers and other stakeholders to find ways to measure complex problems and help quantify business impact of various initiatives. You will communicate complex analytical results in a clear and easy-to-understand way and will drive towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems while considering edge cases and different tradeoffs.

Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen, and detail-oriented with excellent problem solving skills. A keen sense of end-to-end ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

About The Team

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Dallas, TX, USA | New York, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets

 Senior Programmer Analyst, Insight Analytics 

EAB Seramount is a strategic business dedicated to advancing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the workplace.

Our business is in growth mode and offers the right person the opportunity to be part of a diverse, dynamic, creative, and highly skilled team partnering with leading companies to advance more inclusive corporate cultures.

This role combines extraordinary programming, data processing and reporting skills with the opportunity to do high-impact work for Seramount’s Best Companies research initiatives .

The ideal candidate will be a top-notch programmer and analyst, detailed planner, and expert communicator who is committed to the discovery, development, and delivery of innovative solutions that provide automated, customizable analytical reports to our growing customer base.

This hire may be based in Washington, DC or Richmond, VA; this position is also open to remote employment within the continental United States.

Ability to work collaboratively with internal customers, one-on-one, in large groups, or individually with minimal supervision.Desire to work in a fast-paced, data driven, metrics-oriented environmentStrategic thinker

The anticipated starting salary (base) range for this role is $62,500 to $90,000 per year. Actual salary varies due to factors that may include but not be limited to relevant experience, skills, and location. Description:
Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 40% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

Summary

Our Go-To-Market (GTM) Analytics team is responsible for helping our teams make the best decisions in their business based on data. As we continue to grow at an incredible pace, our demands for data continue to grow even faster.

We are looking for 2 individuals to join the team. Reporting into our Director, GTM Analytics, these roles will be responsible for being the Analytics business partner to the Field (Sales, Technical Solutions and Channel) and Customer (Customer Success, Professional Services and Renewals) organizations, owning the relevant dashboards and ad-hoc analysis necessary to support these teams with decision making.

We are focused on candidates located on the East coast of the US.

What You’ll Do

Be the main point of contact for all data insights for the Sales organization, working closely with the Field or Customer Operations teams Define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), as well as provide ad-hoc, actionable, business insights based on your close understanding of the organization and the data it is generating Meticulously review and optimize existing dashboards and data sources to maximise the efficiency with which we deliver insights to our teams Partner with our IT team to ensure that our we maintain a strong data foundation on which our data insights are generated Collaborate with Finance and Marketing to ensure data definition/data calculation consistency Be a representative for “Data” on cross-functional projects, ensuring that any new initiatives or changes can be supported with relevant insights (and that any existing infrastructure is prepared to support the changes) 

What You’ll Bring

A degree in a quantitative field and 4+ years’ experience working in a high growth SaaS company (or 7+ years without a degree), preferably working with Field or Customer teams. Advanced proficiency and a high level of passion for using tools (including spreadsheets, SQL databases and Tableau) to take large sets of data and create clear, easy to action, summaries Strong understanding of the importance of building visualisations and models that scale in a fast-growing organization An equal level of comfort being involved in granular, technical, conversations about data as well as where a high-level executive summary focus is required (and the ability to tailor what you share based on the audience) Is adept at building relationships with stakeholders at all level of the organization to work collaboratively, rather than in isolation 

If your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

Five Principles for Success

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.

Always improve, Always Advance - Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen

Passionately Professional - Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best

Hypothesize - Practice - Validate – Shikumika - Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory

Maximize Customer Satisfaction - The greatest satisfaction for our teams is seeing their customers smile

Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! - Always be conscious of time - take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team

Job Title: Insights Analyst Department (eCommerce): Category Management Location: US – Various (Scottsdale/Dallas/Remote) Reporting Relationships: Category Management (with a dotted line to OMNI) Key Relationships: Sales, NPD, Marketing

  • Responsible for generating actionable insights through weekly/monthly reporting and participation in NPD research.
  • Act as a key stakeholder in customer meetings, providing valuable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and update weekly/monthly reporting for key OMNI retailers.
  • Analyze e-commerce data to extract actionable insights.
  • Conduct research on competitors, alternative markets, and e-commerce opportunities.
  • Collaborate on ideas to improve the company's e-commerce strategy.
  • Advise various stakeholders on e-commerce matters.
  • Drive growth for MPM brands in the OMNI channel by identifying whitespace opportunities, assortment gaps, and first-to-market opportunities.
  • Promote data-driven decision-making across the business.
  • Contribute insights to forecasting discussions based on market trends.
  • Participate in NPD discussions and assess market viability.
  • Collaborate with Sales and Finance teams to optimize reporting tools.
  • Ensure accuracy of data delivery from providers through regular checks and monitoring.

Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:

Essential:

  • Proficiency in using retailer data platforms for reporting and analysis.
  • Understanding of online purchase drivers.
  • Attention to detail, curiosity, and motivation to work in an international setting.
  • Creative, intuitive, and forward-thinking mindset.
  • Analytical skills with the ability to identify trends and draw conclusions.
  • Experience crafting compelling sales stories based on insights.
  • Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Strong presentation skills for both internal and external meetings.
  • Comfortable handling large, complex datasets from various sources.
  • Flexibility with working hours to accommodate cross-timezone meetings.

Desirable:

  • 2+ years of Category Management/Commercial experience in a CPG environment.
  • Familiarity with US ecomm retailer landscapes, objectives, processes, and ways of working.
  • Experience developing and executing category strategies, tactics, and plans.
